summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter record detailing the emergency medical response to Jeffrey Epstein's cardiac arrest in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM) on August 10, 2019. It documents the resuscitation efforts, including CPR, intubation, and medication administration, before his transport to a local emergency room.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell, received emergency resuscitation for cardiac arrest, and was transported to a local ER.

events.title: Epstein's Cardiac Arrest and Resuscitation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. A body alarm was activated at 0635. Correctional officers initiated CPR. He was cold, had bruising around the neck, fixed and dilated pupils, and no palpable pulses. Advanced life support was performed, including AED (no shock advised), intubation by paramedics, and administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate. He was transported to a local emergency room with CPR in progress.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:35 AM.
The clinical notes describe 'circumferential Bruising around the neck' and 'posterior mottling' upon initial assessment.

Resuscitation efforts included CPR initiated by correctional officers, AED application (no shock advised), intubation by paramedics, and administration of multiple doses of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate.
Epstein was in asystole (no cardiac electrical activity) and was transported to a local emergency room with ongoing CPR.
The document is a formal Bureau of Prisons health services record generated on the day of the incident, detailing the timeline and medical interventions.
